intro: Dortmanna deckenii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its foliage is thick and velvety, with a deep green color, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Dortmanna deckenii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
